The twelfth [chapter] is on divorce, and it should be known that it is permissible but it is the most detested of permissible things to Allah the Exalted. It is only permissible if there is no harm without right, and whenever he divorces her, he has harmed her. It is not permissible to harm others except due to a transgression from her side or a necessity from his side. Allah the Exalted said: (Then if they obey you, do not seek a way against them) meaning do not seek a stratagem for separation. And if her father dislikes her, let him divorce her. Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, said: I had a wife whom I loved, and my father disliked her and ordered me to divorce her, so I consulted the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and he said: O Ibn Umar, divorce your wife. This indicates that the right of the parent takes precedence, but a parent who dislikes her without a corrupt purpose like Umar. And whenever she harms her husband and is insolent toward his family, she is a transgressor. Likewise, if she is of bad character or corrupt in religion. Ibn Mas'ud said regarding His statement, the Exalted: 'nor should they leave except that they commit a clear immorality' - whenever she is insolent toward his family and harms her husband, that is an immorality. This is intended for the waiting period, but it is an indication of the intended meaning. And if the harm is from the husband, she may ransom herself by giving wealth; it is disliked for the man to take from her more than what he gave, for that is injustice against her and oppression upon her and trading on the private part. He, the Exalted, said: 'Then there is no blame upon them for what she gives back.' So returning what he took or less is suitable for the ransom. If she asks for divorce without any wrongdoing, she is sinful. He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: (Any woman who asks her husband for divorce without any wrongdoing will not smell the fragrance of Paradise). In another wording: 'Paradise is forbidden to her.' And in another wording: He, peace and blessings be upon him, said: (The women who seek khul' are the hypocrites).
